question:
You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate can be executed and displayed properly.
Please help me implement the following requirement using code. Create using SVG code: The school bell is ringing.

checklist.title: Is the SVG bell structure accurately and completely implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements a realistic bell structure using SVG elements, including the bell body (dome shape), clapper, handle/mounting system, and proper proportional relationships. Score 0 if only basic shapes are used without bell characteristics, 5 if basic bell outline is present but lacks detail, and 10 if a complete and recognizable bell structure with all components is implemented.

checklist.title: Is the ringing animation effect properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG animation accurately simulates bell ringing behavior, including pendulum motion of the bell body, clapper movement inside the bell, and realistic swing patterns using SVG animations (animateTransform, animate). Deduct 5 points if only simple rotation is used without physics-based motion, and 3 points if the clapper doesn't move independently. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are visual sound effects and environmental elements included?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes visual representations of sound waves, vibration effects, or environmental context (like a school building, clock tower, or mounting structure). Check for creative visual indicators that enhance the 'ringing' concept such as radiating circles, particle effects, or contextual background elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation timing and physics realistic?
checklist.description: Check whether the animation follows realistic physics principles with proper timing, easing functions, and momentum. The bell should swing with decreasing amplitude over time, and the clapper should move naturally relative to the bell's motion. Deduct 5 points if animations are linear without easing, and 3 points if the timing doesn't feel natural. Give 10 points if physics-based animation is fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, SVG rendering problems, animation performance on different devices) and provide fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle edge cases and maintain functionality across different environments, giving 10 points. If robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no error handling exists, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visual experience (e.g., 1. Interactive controls to start/stop ringing 2. Multiple bell types or customizable bell designs 3. Sound wave visualization patterns 4. Day/night environmental changes). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar animations (e.g., multiple swing mechanisms coexisting) 2. Elements unrelated to bell ringing (e.g., unrelated decorative objects) 3. Overly complex effects that don't enhance the bell concept. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core bell functionality is obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG structure organization, proper use of groups and transformations, clean animation definitions, and reusable components. Deduct 5 points if SVG structure is poorly organized or transformations are inefficient; deduct 5 points if animations are not optimized for performance; deduct 5 points if the code lacks modularity and reusability. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the bell design follows realistic proportions and aesthetically pleasing visual principles: 1) Proper color scheme that reflects metallic bell materials 2) Appropriate shading and highlighting to show dimensionality 3) Clean stroke weights and consistent styling throughout. Deduct 3 points for unrealistic proportions, 5 points for poor color choices that don't represent a bell, and 5 points for inconsistent visual styling. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and performant?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG animations run smoothly without stuttering: 1) Frame rate consistency during animation cycles 2) Smooth transitions between animation states 3) Optimized SVG paths and transforms for performance 4) Proper use of CSS animations vs SVG animations where appropriate. Deduct 5 points for choppy animations, 3 points for performance issues on standard devices, and 5 points for poorly optimized animation code. The full score is 10 points.
